alert.note: Alert for Central and Southeast Phillips; Garfield; Petroleum (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 06 at 2:21PM MDT until June 06 at 11:45PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Montana, including the following areas, Central and Southeast Phillips, Garfield, Northern Phillips, Petroleum and Southwest Phillips. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A weather system approaching the region will lead to increasing thunderstorms Thursday afternoon through Friday night. These storms will be capable of producing heavy rainfall over a short period of time. Since soils are already saturated from recent rainfall, these storms will lead to increased risk of localized flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Central and Southeast Phillips; Garfield; Petroleum
